info.title: Cloud Export Configuration API
info.description:
# Overview
In Kentik, a "cloud export" is an object whose properties are the values that Kentik needs to access network flow logs from a given set of resources in a given cloud provider (see [Cloud Exports and Devices](https://kb.kentik.com/v4/Na00.htm#Na00-Cloud_Exports_and_Devices)). The Cloud Export API enables programmatic management of cloud exports, serving two primary functions:
* Configuration of the Kentik resources required to export network flow logs and metadata from [public clouds](https://kb.kentik.com/v4/Na00.htm).
* Basic status information on active export processes.

### Supported Cloud Providers
The functionality and configuration parameters supported by this API differ by cloud provider. The API currently supports the following providers:
* [Amazon Web Services](https://kb.kentik.com/v0/Bd06.htm) (AWS)
* [Microsoft Azure](https://kb.kentik.com/v0/Bd08.htm)
* [Google Cloud](https://kb.kentik.com/v0/Bd07.htm) (GCP)
* [Oracle Cloud](https://kb.kentik.com/v0/Bd12.htm) (OCI)

### Additional Public Resources
The following additional resources are available for working with this API:
* Kentik community [Python](https://github.com/kentik/community_sdk_python) and [Go](https://github.com/kentik/community_sdk_golang) SDKs provide language-specific support for using this and other Kentik APIs. These SDKs can be also used as example code for development.
* A [Terraform provider](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/kentik/kentik-cloudexport) is available for configuring `cloud_export` instances in Kentik. Terraform modules are available for [AWS](https://github.com/kentik/config-snippets-cloud/tree/master/cloud_AWS/terraform/module), [Azure](https://github.com/kentik/config-snippets-cloud/tree/master/cloud_Azure/terraform/module) 
and [GCP](https://github.com/kentik/config-snippets-cloud/tree/master/cloud_GCP/terraform/module).
These modules support onboarding and ongoing management of all resources (in public clouds and in Kentik) required to export flow logs to Kentik.

# Anatomy of a Cloud Export
Configuration and status of a `cloud_export` instance is represented by the `CloudExport` object, which contains three categories of attributes:
* Common Configuration Attributes
* Cloud Provider Configuration Attributes
* Metadata and Status Attributes

### Common Configuration Attributes
The configuration attributes in the table below are common to `CloudExport` objects for all cloud providers.
| Attribute | Required | Default |
|-----------|----------| ------- |
| enabled | No | False |
| name | Yes |   |
| description | No | <empty string> |
| type | Yes | |
| cloud_provider | Yes | |
| plan_id | Yes | |

### Cloud Provider Specific Attributes
The attributes listed in the table below are objects whose parameters are specific to each cloud provider.
| Cloud Provider | Attribute | Object Name |
|-----------|----------| ------- |
| AWS | aws | AwsProperties |
| Azure | azure | AzureProperties |
| Google Cloud | gce | GceProperties |
| OCI Cloud | oci | OciProperties |

### Metadata and Status Attributes
The attributes in the table below provide read-only metadata and status for a `cloud_export` instance.
| Attribute | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| id | System-generated unique identifier of the instance |
| cdate | Creation timestamp |
| edate | Last-modification timestamp |
| current_status | Runtime status of the flow and metadata collection process |

get.description: Returns a list of all cloud exports in the account.

post.description: Create new cloud export based on configuration in the request.

put.description: Replace complete configuration of a cloud export with data in the request.

get.summary: Get cloud export configuration and status.
get.description: Returns configuration and status of cloud export with specified ID.

parameters.name: export.id
parameters.description: ID of the cloud export to be retrieved.

delete.description: Delete cloud export with specified ID.

parameters.name: export.id
parameters.description: ID of the cloud export to be deleted.

type.description: Ownership of the cloud export process/agent

enabled.description: Attribute controlling whether the instance is active

name.description: User selected name of the instance

planId.description: Identifier of the billing plan for the instance

currentStatus.description: Runtime status of the export process

iamRoleArn.description: ARN of the IAM role granted access to the S3 bucket and describe API end-points.

region.description: Name of AWS region from which to export flow logs.

metadataOnly.description: Import only metadata without any flows (default false).

collectFlowLogs.description: Import metadata and collect flow logs (default true).

collectFirewallLogs.description: Import metadata and collect firewall logs in addition to flow logs (default false). Note that in order to collect firewall logs without collection of flow logs, collect_flow_logs must be set to false.

collectMetrics.description: Import metadata and collect metrics data.  Note that flow logs will still be collected unless metadata_only is also set to true. (default false).

bucket.description: Name of S3 bucket from which flow and/or firewall logs are to be exported.

bucketPrefix.description: Prefix of S3 bucket from which flow and/or firewall logs are to be exported.

deleteAfterRead.description: Delete from logs from the S3 bucket after export (default false).

awsIamRoleArnIsOrg.description: Iam role is organization role (default false).

secondaryAwsAccounts.description: Accounts ids granted access to the describe API end-points.

secondaryAwsBlockedAccounts.description: Accounts ids that should be filtered from organization when running describe API end-points.

secondaryAwsRegions.description: Regions of secondary accounts from which to collect metadata.

secondaryAwsSuffix.description: Used to generate secondary account ARN based on template arn:aws:iam::<<aws_account_id>>:role/<<role_suffix>>

location.description: Azure region/location from which to export flow logs.

resourceGroup.description: Resource group containing the NSG generating flow logs.

storageAccount.description: Storage account from which flow logs are to be extracted.

subscriptionId.description: ID of Azure account from which flows logs are to be exported.

securityPrincipalEnabled.description: Indication whether security principal for the Kentik flow export application has been authorized.

type.description: Ownership of the cloud export process/agent

enabled.description: Attribute controlling whether the instance is active

name.description: User selected name of the instance

planId.description: Identifier of the billing plan for the instance

currentStatus.description: Runtime status of the export process

samplingEnabled.description: Boolean indicating if sampling is used for this export.

samplingType.description: Sampling type for the export. Options are: `CLOUD_EXPORT_SAMPLING_UNSAMPLED` for exporting all flows, and `CLOUD_EXPORT_SAMPLING_RATE` for exporting sampled flows.  If CLOUD_EXPORT_SAMPLING_RATE is used, the `sampling_rate` field must be set to a value greater than 0 and less than 2000.

v202506CloudExportSamplingType.title:
- CLOUD_EXPORT_SAMPLING_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Invalid value.
 - CLOUD_EXPORT_SAMPLING_TYPE_RATE: Export all flows
 - CLOUD_EXPORT_SAMPLING_TYPE_UNSAMPLED: Export sampled flows

errorMessage.description: Text of the last error message (empty if status is OK).

flowFound.description: Indication whether any flow data were exported.

apiAccess.description: Indication whether the export process is able to access cloud API.

storageAccountAccess.description: Indication whether the export process is able to access storage account containing flow logs.

v202506CloudExportType.description:
- CLOUD_EXPORT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Invalid value.
 - CLOUD_EXPORT_TYPE_KENTIK_MANAGED: Cloud export process is managed by Kentik
 - CLOUD_EXPORT_TYPE_CUSTOMER_MANAGED: Cloud export process is managed by customer
v202506CloudExportType.title: CloudExportType

v202506CloudProvider.description:
- CLOUD_PROVIDER_UNSPECIFIED: Invalid value.
 - CLOUD_PROVIDER_AWS: Amazon Web Services
 - CLOUD_PROVIDER_AZURE: Microsoft Azure
 - CLOUD_PROVIDER_GCE: Google Cloud
 - CLOUD_PROVIDER_OCI: OCI
v202506CloudProvider.title: CloudProvider

project.description: Name of the project from which to export flow logs.

subscription.description: GCP Pub/Sub subscription providing flow logs.

metadataOnly.description: Import only metadata without any flows (default false).

collectFlowLogs.description: Import metadata and collect flow logs (default true).

collectMetrics.description: Import metadata and collect metrics data.  Note that flow logs will still be collected unless metadata_only is also set to true. (default false).

invalidExportsCount.description: Number of objects with invalid data (which are not returned in the response).

ociUserId.description: ID of the user created to represent the Kentik cloud export tool.

ociCompartmentId.description: Compartment IDs from which to collect metadata.

ociDefaultRegion.description: Default Enabled Region from which to collect metadata.

ociCollectFlowLogs.description: Import metadata and collect flow logs (default true).

ociBucketName.description: Name of the bucket from which flow logs are to be extracted.  Required if collecting flow logs (default)

ociBucketNamespaceName.description: Namespace of the bucket from which flow logs are to be extracted.  Required if collecting flow logs (default)

ociFlowObjectNamePrefix.description: We will look for files in the bucket whose names start with {%prefix%}/{%service_connector_ocid%}

metadataOnly.description: Import only metadata without any flows (default false).
